message.content: This question requires knowledge about environmentally friendly practices. Option (D) is the correct answer because salvaging plastic bottles instead of throwing them away helps reduce waste and promotes recycling. Option (A) is incorrect because Styrofoam is not environmentally friendly and does not decompose easily. Option (B) is incorrect because using more paper towels leads to increased deforestation. Option (C) is incorrect because driving a car that guzzles gas contributes to air pollution and carbon emissions.

This question requires some basic knowledge about environmental sustainability and the impact of different actions on the environment. Option (D) is the correct answer because salvaging plastic bottles instead of throwing them away helps reduce waste and promote recycling. Styrofoam plates and bowls (option A) are not environmentally friendly as they do not decompose easily and contribute to pollution. Using more paper towels (option B) leads to increased deforestation and waste. Driving a car that guzzles gas (option C) increases carbon emissions and contributes to air pollution. Therefore, option (D) is the only option that has a positive impact on the environment.

This question requires knowledge about ways to have a positive impact on the environment. Option (D) is the correct answer because salvaging plastic bottles instead of throwing them away helps reduce waste and promotes recycling. Option (A) is incorrect because Styrofoam plates and bowls are harmful to the environment as they are not biodegradable. Option (B) is incorrect because using more paper towels increases deforestation and waste. Option (C) is incorrect because driving a car that guzzles gas increases pollution and contributes to climate change.

This question requires knowledge about environmentally friendly practices. To have a positive impact on the environment, it is important to make choices that minimize waste and promote sustainability. Option (D) is the correct answer because salvaging plastic bottles instead of throwing them away helps reduce plastic waste and promotes recycling. Option (A) is incorrect because Styrofoam plates and bowls are not environmentally friendly and contribute to pollution. Option (B) is also incorrect because using more paper towels means more trees are being cut down, which is harmful to the environment. Option (C) is incorrect because driving a car that guzzles gas contributes to air pollution and is not environmentally friendly.

This question requires knowledge about actions that have a positive impact on the environment. Option (D), salvaging plastic bottles instead of throwing them away, is the correct answer. This is because recycling plastic bottles helps to reduce waste and conserve resources. Options (A), (B), and (C) are all negative actions for the environment. Using Styrofoam plates and bowls contributes to non-biodegradable waste. Using more paper towels leads to increased deforestation for paper production. Driving a car that guzzles gas contributes to pollution and the release of greenhouse gases.

This question is about taking actions that have a positive impact on the environment. Option (D), salvaging plastic bottles instead of throwing them away, is the correct answer. This is because plastic bottles are made from non-biodegradable materials that can take hundreds of years to decompose in landfills. By salvaging them, we can recycle the plastic and reduce the amount of waste that ends up in landfills. Options (A), (B), and (C) are incorrect because they all involve actions that harm the environment. Styrofoam plates and bowls are not biodegradable and contribute to landfill waste. Using more paper towels means cutting down more trees, which is harmful to the environment. Driving a car that guzzles gas contributes to air pollution and the emission of greenhouse gases.

This question assesses knowledge about environmentally friendly choices. Option (D) is the correct answer because salvaging plastic bottles and recycling them instead of throwing them away helps reduce waste and the use of new resources. Options (A) and (B) are not environmentally friendly as Styrofoam plates and bowls create non-biodegradable waste, and using more paper towels leads to unnecessary deforestation. Option (C) is also not environmentally friendly because driving a car that guzzles gas contributes to air pollution and the depletion of fossil fuels.
